intro: Bothriopodium, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plants typically have a low-growing habit with basal leaves and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Bothriopodium species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils. They play a role in stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in their native habitats.
